reviewText: Attention: I am NOT reviewing Arma 3 solo play. I am reviewing the online multiplayer in Altis Life and Asylum..\nFirst of all, let me just say that a majority of the people I've come across in this game are complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. They'll kill you, take your stuff, harrass you, etc; all while you have your back turned. HOWEVER.. the rest of the gameplay makes up for it. This is one of those games where you need friends. Don't have friends? Make some. It is so unbelieveably easy to make friends in this game and at that point you can actually have a promising team to get ♥♥♥♥ done. You WILL NOT succeed on your own. Sorry, if you're a solo player, you're gunna need a team at some point. Altis Life is a game mode. It's fun, and there's no limit to what you can actually do. Be a cop - Check. Be a rebel - Check. Be a taxi driver - Check. Be a paramedic - Check.\nI love this game for the time I've played and I recommend it to anyone who's willing to die over and over, to eventually succeed.

reviewText: If you are like me and striving to find a non-stop co-op game to play with friends, look no further, because Arma 3 has it all. I have owned this game for 3 days, it was bought by my brother, and I can say... It was worth every cent and hour put into this game. I literally spent all my play time on one map, Altis and one Invade and Annex server, this game is extremely tactical, and is WAY better with friends to play. This game makes Battlefield look like Call of Duty. This game has no linear gameplay, no solo mission, none of the garbage most of the modern day shooters have to offer. This game is a epic military installment and has earned the title of simulator. If you were a fan of tactical shooters back in the day, Arma 3 is for you.

reviewText: ARMA 3 is very different from ARMA 2, It is not a game for people that want fast action gaming, this is a game for people who appreciate the small things, this game requires patience and tactical skill, There are experiences in ARMA 3 that you will not experience in Battlefield, or Call Of Duty, for example the tactical aspect of ARMA 3, if your lucky enough to be part of a tactical community then you can get the full benefits of playing ARMA 3, not like wasteland or altis life. ARMA 3 has burst up from the old ARMA's from the help of Dayz, i'm not saying Dayz game arma all the populatrity but it defintly gave them the boost they needed.\n\nI remeber when i first joined a tactical server, i was a noob, i had no clue what these call signs ment, or any command chain. But i was rushed to a heli and placed into bravo squad, i was told to stick next to the medkit, when i look back i think i chose the marksman load out, i was not very useful to the group in till we revived a lot of heavy fire, once are squad lead went down, it was just me and the medic, as the medic couldn't go down i had to rush out into the feild, dragging theese random people back to cover, now i did not know any of theese people, but in the moment it felt like i did, i felt like i was part of the team. Once i dragged half of my bleeding team out, i was assigned a special job, i was given satchel charges to blow up the objective, when i came up to the tower i had a little trouble setting it, but never the less i manage to place down the charge, as i ran back in a big rush to the heli evac, i looked around and saw the tower blow, it came crashing down into the hill. At the moment i relised this is what ARMA 3 is ment to be like. 9.5/10 -Lewis
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Simply can't live up to Arma 2's legacy. I mean yeah, it has some major improvements over Arma 2, but it sure can't live it down.

Game lacks content.

However, so long as you can run the game well in Multiplayer (Quad core 3.2GHz+ CPU & GTX 560+) it's still worth the buy (Organized PvP is very promising, COOP missions are very interesting, and RPGs are fun as well).

At least there's mods. Seriously, it fills the void.

Don't buy this game unless you have a computer that can handle it.

EDIT:

Constant updates improved the game and made even vanilla gameplay a genuinely enjoyable experience, let alone the helicopter an marksman DLC.

Mods are better than ever. ACE 3 finally came out in an early state, but hopefully realism will flourish in Arma again. RPGs are improving a ton in mods with Arma 3 Life and other mods, as well as survival types with new content. RHS bring back US and Russian Forces in A3 quality and new maps continue to bring interest.

Still requires a good build to enjoy the game. Although it's been much improved, still needs optimization.

You'll also want a good sound mod and Blastcore particle effects mod... its amazing.

reviewText: The latest installment for the military simulation franchise which has been around for eons is a very nice step in the right direction in general. Arma 3 Features two new maps called Stratis (which can be compared to Utes of Arma 2) and Altis, which is a mammoth sized map that stretches roughly 27 kilometers in East to West length. The Arma series has been prone to a multitude of bugs and poor optimization, which is still evident in the latest insatllment, yet the optimization has been FAR improved in this version of Bohemia Interactive's spotlight franchise. The graphics in this game are very improved and look beautiful on Ultra settings (that is, if you can run it). This game is still prone to glitches, bugs and sudden extreme drops of framerate without warning. Some of the bugs are eveident in player movent, which has been vastly improved upon the last installment, allowing you to take on 9 tactical positions when shooting. The movement is far less clunky and works much smoother than Arma 2. Some of the movement bugs can mean that you accidentally can get stuck in a rock or wall and end up dying from being squashed. The vehicles have been greatly improved offering far more realistic physics (however the physics are not on the par of games like Forza 5) with realistic vehicle speeds. The vehicles on the other hand are painstakingly delicate and fragile than before making vehicle operating quite frustrating at times. The weapon mechanics have been totally overhauled since the previous Arma game with new damage mechanics and far more realistic recoil effects. Arma 3 also has added a new dimension to its already diverse playability, adding a more in depth (no pun intended) maritime experience. This allows you to dive to the depths of th eocean and use submarises as well. Some of the things I want to see in Arma 3 are missing such as the ability to take cover behind doors of a vehicle whilst riding in it to avoid being shot easlliy (for example, if you are driving or in the passenger seat of a car you can hold a button to allow you character to switch into 1st person view and duck behind the dashboard and door of the car). Another missing feature is the ability to shoot in vehicles with you character's weapons allowing for military simmulation dirve-bys. My final verdict of Arma 3 is a very solid 8.5 out of 10. Arma 3 offers a very vast and expansive game that has a nearly infinite replayability, yet some of its bugs and optimization hold back Bohemia Interactive's flagship series back once more. If these glitches were to be fixed Arma 3 could be a very famous game that could be a serious threat to games like the Call of Duty franchise or Battlefield franchise as well. Buying this game is a choice you will not regret and with a little time and patience, you can have a blast on this game.

reviewText: Ahhh Arma 3 the third expansion of the Arma series. I love it and hate it at the same time at different moments. The increased modding capabilities really made me really interested. The main thing that REALLY disappointed me was the lack of variety in the weapons and vehicle department. They weren't really unique but the gear system helped add more variety to the cosmetics of the characters but, that doesn't really help due to the fact the weapons don't have much variety. I love the Arma 3 campaign, not as personal and deep as the Arma 2 campaign but still fun. There are still SOO many bugs that need fixing and Optimization for multiplayer FPS wise is very bad at the moment too. I still give this game a 7/10 since it has many abilities from Arma 2 and is still fun. Expect a lot of bugs though and a few random FPS drops but, that doesn't really effect the gameplay as much.

reviewText:
I was actually one of the first people to pre-order this game's Supporter Edition on March 5th 2013 and so far the game evolved from a 7-8/10 military shooter with emphasis on realism to a 12/10 Military Simulator, the probably best mod support of any game currently on the market and an extensive community that happily accepts new players.

If you're searching for realistic military operations in a videogame, ArmA is for you.
If you're searching for some open world roleplaying or general TVT action, ArmA is for you.
If you would like to be part of a group that conducts CO-OP and/or TVT missions together, ArmA is for you.

Additionally one very huge part of this game is the mod support, literally anything you can imagine ranging from fictional spaceships to realistically modeled Main Battle Tanks as well as all accompanying features can be downloaded and used in game, just a few mods I would recommend checking out:

JSRS 3 Dragonfyre, the successor to the very popular JSRS2 for ArmA3 and the previous JSRS for ArmA2, this soundmod delivers a high fidelity, realism oriented sound environment, I would strongly recommend checking out a few videos on the official JSRS studio's youtube channel, if you didn't know that it's a mod for a videogame you would probably think that the sounds are part of actual combat footage, that's the fidelity you can expect from JSRS.

Blastcore Phoenix, JSRS is for sounds, Blastcore Phoenix is for visuals, Blastcore Phoenix which is also currently in developement is the successor of the very popular Blastcore mods for ArmA2 and ArmA3, this mod delivers realistic high quality explosion and smoke effects while still maintaining good ingame performance, if you want to check this mod out, make sure that you're specificially searching for Blastcore Phoenix as the new mod is quite a lot different from the old ones.

RHS Escalation, this mod is actually split up into two mods and has been released only a couple of days ago, it brings very high quality, contemporary Russian and American assets into the game including, vehicles, weapons and uniforms, despite the mod being in a very early stage at version 0.30 it already has considerably more content than the main game, this mod is definitely worth being checked out.

Authentic Gameplay Modification, this mod could be regarded as the successor for the Advanced Combat Environment 1 and 2 modifications for ArmA2, they take this game from being somewhat beginner friendly and while already very realistic to a Simulation that may be mistaken with VBS, the military training simulator developed by a sub company of Bohemia Interactive, this mod may not be for everyone but if you're looking for the most realistic military experience that can be delivered by a game, this mod is definitely worth checking out

Advanced Combat Radio Environment or Task Force Arrowhead Radio, these two mods which actually could be considered rivals provide the game with very realistic communication in form of an overhauled VON and simulated real world radio models they also come with a very high fidelity UI, they achieve all this by using a teamspeak plugin.

The TL:DR of this would be: Should you get ArmA? Yes.

reviewText:
Ok, well im not entirely sure what to put here. But in my experience of the game its a bit like pancakes. So here is the recipe for success

INGREDIENTS1 large egg or 1 egg and one yolk
½ pint/280ml milk
4oz/110g plain flour (4 heaped dessertspoons)
1 tbsp melted butter

METHODBy hand: sift the flour into a bowl and make a well in the middle. Break in the egg (and yolk, if using) and add a pinch of salt and a splash of the milk. Whisk the egg, gradually incorporating the flour, to make a smooth cream. Whisk in the rest of the milk and the melted butter.
With a blender: put all the ingredients in a blender jug with a pinch of salt. Whizz until smooth. It should be no thicker than single cream.
Brush a hot pan with vegetable oil before adding a ladleful of batter and swilling thinly around pan, tipping the pan so the mixture spreads evenly. It will begin to cook immediately: pour any excess back into the bowl.When the pancake is browned on the bottom and the very edges are beginning to lift away, give the pan a shake to make sure the pancake is loose. If it is sticking anywhere, use a spatula to loosen it. When it moves freely, then you are ready to toss it - or, if you're less confident, use a spatula to turn it over. The other side will only need a few seconds. Slide out of the pan, and try one of these delicious toppings

reviewText:
Arma 3 is a very well built Mil-Sim.  You usually find your breath taken where ever you go, whether it's the ocean or a mountain, a very beautiful game, but like everything else in this world, behind the beautiful side is a scary side, coming at you with jets, tanks, armed boats and infantry platoon!

This game offers an immersive campaign and a fun multiplayer.  The modded community of this game is very active, with constant stream of mods flooding the workshop!  Some mods are very popular, like Epoch which adds in a survival theme to the game and allows from building structures.

This game can be very fun if played with a group of friends, everyone with their own role, working together to complete a mission.  Highly recommended!

reviewText:
With over 3,100 hours, I think I am more than qualified to tell you about the game.

So, what is ArmA 3? ArmA 3 is a tactical fps/third person shooter simulator. Quite a mouthful huh? ArmA 3, I would have to say is by far the best game I have ever played, and until ArmA 4 comes out, the best game I will ever play. Bohemia has truelly one upped most, if not all, shooting games out there to date. And with the mature, professional community that plays ArmA 3, it is not hard to find excellent modifications to the game. Some of the best community game mods I can recommend to you right now are Altis Life and ArmA 3 Life.

However, should you find yourself more interested in the tactical side of ArmA, there are units out there that replicate real world military units, that provide tactical gameplay, as well as assisting you to better yourself in the field of ArmA 3. But before you go do anything, be sure to play the campaign, as that will help you learn ArmAs mechanics, and assist you in your career of ArmA. While I myself am still looking for a role play server. There are plenty of MilSim units out there though. 173rd Airborne Brigade, 15th MEU. Currently I am apart of the 173rd and can almost guarantee that you will enjoy it. Recruiting Now.

TeamSpeak IP: ts3.173rd.us

Website Link: http://beta.173rd.us/index.php?
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I first started playing Arma 2 OA/CO, I loved Benny's warfare mode, I played it all the time, and I had really good experiences, when I heard that Arma 3 was announced, and saw first look trailer, I was really hyped, soon Alpha came out and I bought it, also enjoyed it a lot, I have much more to say, but I won't make it too long as I want people to actually read it.

I would like to fully recommend this game, I will write some pros and cons about this game below, and give it a rating at the end.

Pros:

It's Arma! game where you can feel actual war and gunfight, unlike most of other popular shooters, which don't have this real experience like Arma series games.

HUGE and great modding community, which helps make game possible and better.

In-game editor, very user friendly, and full of features, you just want to get in and fly a specific helicopter? why not create a mission in editor in less than 15 seconds? or try something more complicated? even get invovled in modding?

Great physics which is essential for proper simulation game, especially aircraft physics.

Multiplayer is pretty diverse, theres everything from life roleplay to survival to actual PVE and PVP warfare.

As I said game is very diverse, but in most cases you have to plan ahead and use your mind, not only left mouse button unlike other shooters to be successful.

As always, great soundtrack.

Cons:

You might get lost in this game, learning it is not easy. I know few people who gave up on this game because they could not instantly learn everything. (My opinion: I consider complicated games more fun tbh)

In Arma 2 (OA) I used to love armored tanks, and stationary artilery, but Arma 3 seems to lack both of them, there are both tanks and stationary artilery in game, but they don't feel same and are very less varied, thats just my opinion.

Game would be nothing without third party modders and developers.

9/10 - Really good game, could use more absolutely different maps (outside greece, for example something similar to takistan from arma 2 oa, you could use mods, but yeah..)

Everyhting above is just my opinion, thanks for attention, and hopefully you enjoyed my review.

reviewText:
Brief Review

Arma 3 from Bohemia Interactive is the latest in its military simulation series of games, which began with the original Operation Flashpoint: Cold War Crisis.

While shipping with a small amount of actual content, that is not what Arma 3 or the Arma franchise is all about. The huge influx of Steam Workshop content, multiplayer and editor make this a full package for the most serious of combat simulator nuts

Pros and Cons

Pros

New vehicle physics are great
Butterfly shadows
Massive world to explore with lots of potential for long-range engagements (270 km²)
Extremely detailed, lush visual presentation
Hyper-realistic combat will satisfy even the most die-hard sim enthusiasts
Huge variety in terms of gameplay scenarios


Cons

Controls feel clunky
Very steep learning curve
You will need a new PC (Most likely)

An Ending

Arma as a franchise is class leading at what it does - Military simulation refined and mastered

reviewText: Fantastic game. The single player content, showcases and training are good. The real meat of the game is in its multiplayer though. Admittedly, it can be a bit confusing at first if you're a new player, as some servers require you to download mods before you can join the server. There doesn't tend to be a whole lot of vanilla" servers out there. However
date: the mods are fantastic and worth the effort
recommended: especially if you play them with a group of people.\n\nMy favorite experience thus far was when we were playing the "Insurgency" mod (military vs terrorists). There's a mod called Task Force Radio
hoursPlayed: which in a nut shell provides much more realistic radios to use. Each faction has their own encrypted radio
voteText: various channels you can switch to and various ranges of radio (long range and short range). As the military
helpfulPercent: we were attempting to locate intel that was known to exist in a village. A squad was unfortunately KIA
votesHelpful: and for the next two hours
votesTotal: the military was getting picked off constantly. I even deployed with a buddy deep into a mountain with full camo
votesFunny: let my team know that where I was and I had good sights on the village
commentsCount: and not 2 minutes later I got sniped even though I was hardly exposed and never took a shot. Later
column16: it turns out they stole a radio off a dead squadmate and were listening to our radio chatter and our positions for 2 hours and we all had a good laugh as the terrorists won.\n\n10/10"
column17: December 30, 2014

reviewText: This game is great. This game has so much content, and BI are bringing more! If you haven't played Arma 2, you will be blown away at the map sizes, of Altis and Stratis. Heaps of weapons and vehicles, and plenty of things to do. There is also a big modding community, and with Arma 3 being very easy to mod, it is a game expanding quite fast. There are heaps of servers that bring you different game types. Also it has full steam workshop support! This game is great to play with friends. Don't expect a Call of Duty.\n\nWorth the money, every dollar.

reviewText: This game is addictive. Yet it has tons of bugs, it's fun. If you are concerned that you won't like it, try watching some Altis Life videos on youtube, and buy the game when it is on Summer or Christmas sale on steam. Now, lets get to what really matters. There are two sides to this game. There are the RP servers, and then there are the MilSims. The RP (RolePlay) servers are easy to get, it deals with Altis and turns your  gaming experience into a life, which then you have to develop your character and become friends (Or enemies) with others. You can mug, kidnap, and ♥♥♥♥ (If you're experienced) other people. This gamemode is for if you want to have some laughs, and a ♥♥♥♥ ton of fun. If you are wanting the military simulator part of this gamemode, then go check the Millitary Simulation Servers. There are fewer of them, but they can be still be fun. This gamemode provides a damn good simulation of War on Altis. Ranging from hardcore strategies to commanding your troops, this gamemode emits a real life enviroment for you to practice your gaming skills in. That's all, hope it helped! (By the way, I reccomend this game a lot, mostly for the people without large ♥♥♥♥ing anger issues.)

reviewText:
HEY YOU, YES YOU!
DO YOU WANT TO BE OPERATOR AS ♥♥♥♥ LIKE MARSOC, NAVY SEALS AND SAS, well maybe dont buy this game unless you are prepared to heavily mod it. Don't take this the wrong way as ArmA 3 is a great game with the custimation or charcters, weapons and more but my biggest problem (and others) it that it lacks the conventional warfare that most ArmA fans were looking for. This was all found in ArmA, weapons you have heard of and excist but if you want these in ArmA 3 you need to mod them in. Another problem is that the map vareity is terrible, 2 maps...really? Plus the PVP is worse than ArmA 2 (somehow???). But this game has outstanding graphics and alot more features than the previous games.

Pros:
-Good Graphics
-Extra customization
-Underwater yay!
-CAN be operator as ♥♥♥♥ (but needs mods)
-Better character movement and vehicle control
-Better campaign (If you want to play it)

Cons: (Some are my own opinion)
-Lacks realisic warfare
-Needs mods to have half the weapons, factions and vehicles of ArmA 2
-Again 2 maps really?! ArmA 2 had 4 on release...
-Damage models are screwed in PVP which is worse than ArmA 2 somehow??
-Getting shot makes you character do a ♥♥♥♥ing disco dance move which makes no sense at all
-Good Graphics: I expand, you need a good system to even run this game on Low-Medium as I found out before I upgraded, even now with my new system (runs GTA 5, Far Cry4 etc on Max above 60fps+) this game runs like a dying dog, ArmA 2 i could max it and get 50+fps all the time, sometimes on ArmA 3 i struggle to get 30+fps.

But remember this review is MY opinion so take from it you will. (Just buy ArmA 2 it better :P)

Thats all folks!

reviewText: ArmA 3 is a game with many pros and some cons. The perfomance, the SP and the vanilla content are defintly questionable, but on the other side this insane moding community will give you the tools you need to modify the game to the experience you want. And this is what make A3 to the best game I ever played. No other game gives you that freedom of choice.\n\nIf you are a new or unexperienced player, don't get scared off by the complexity and clumsiness of ArmA. The solution is to join one of the countless communitys, to learn the rules of the game and enjoy it with othes. Don't bother buying this game if you don't have any patience and no will to get into it - then you defintly will regret it.

reviewText:
A really fun FPS/3P shooter simulator.

The game itself is placed in the future, with prototypes of different vehicles.

But Arma: 3 is still running in a 32-bit environment, which does not allow to use the RAM/VRAM better.

The modding community is awesome and you're surely going to have a great time with this game.
